thread.title: ‘Flash crash’ trader Sarao bailed after he discloses £25m stash
thread.title_full: ‘Flash crash’ trader Sarao bailed after he discloses £25m stash

title: ‘Flash crash’ trader Sarao bailed after he discloses £25m stash
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now ‘Flash crash’ trader Sarao bailed after he discloses £25m stash Mr Sarao has spent more than 100 days in Wandsworth prison, southwest London Mr Sarao has spent more than 100 days in Wandsworth prison, southwest London Harry Wilson Last updated at 2:01PM, August 14 2015 
The Hounslow-based trader accused of helping to trigger the Wall Street “flash crash” five years ago could be freed from prison as early as today after a court agreed to cut his bail surety from £5 million to £50,000. 
Lawyers for Navinder Sarao, 36, agreed a deal with the US authorities whereby more than £25 million of his assets, which they disclosed were held in Switzerland, would be put into a new escrow account, including £2.5 million to cover his legal expenses. 
At a hearing at Westminster magistrates’ court, Mr Sarao’s lawyers said that the trader, who faces up to Subscribe now
